discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: [noblock] I would probably be okay with the name, but if you can't find / convince a registry maintainer to merge it, `PhyloSNaQ` might be a good alternative.

discussion.author: jjustison
discussion.text:
[noblock] Thanks for the guidance, @goerz! I'll try pinging some of the folks in the Julia slack

The core functions from this package package  were originally a part of [PhyloNetworks](https://github.com/JuliaPhylo/PhyloNetworks.jl) but we recently split things out to keep the scope more focused and have things a bit more modular. SNaQ is the name of the approach published [here](https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1005896) and has been known as such in the phylogenetic community, so we would like to keep the name as `SNaQ.jl`

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: Sure, I understand, but I can't override the 5-character rule. You would need a full registry maintainer to merge it manually
